review_text:
This is a nice spray bottle kit, it comes with 2 funnels and a sheet of labels, I found the labels too small for use, each one is approximately 1 inch x 1/2 inch in diameter, and not sure if it can be used in an inkjet printer or not. All 10 spray bottles included all the necessary parts, and the stem that draws up liquid was long in each one, none were short and I really appreciated that. You should be able to spray down to the last drop. I tested mine with rubbing alcohol, for sanitizing my phones. The funnel came in handy for filling the bottle. It made the job so easy! The sprayer does spray a very fine mist. I used it several times to clean some things then left it overnight with the cap on. Next day I tested it again. First off, the cap contained some of the rubbing alcohol inside it, which means the container will leak into the cap standing up. Not necessarily a huge deal breaker, but a negative for me. Holding it in my hand I got the rubbing alcohol on my finger too, so this may waste product just from this. Several drops every 24 hours may not seem like a lot, but if you make your own essential oil room spray then this could be an expensive waste. Lastly, I had an issue with the spray top, the angle is so slight I wasn't sure if I would spray myself in the face of I wasn't wearing eyeglasses. You have to be careful, ensuring you're spraying away from yourself. I did not get any leakage of the alcohol out of the cap, it seemed pretty tight. It did pool in the cap, didn't run down the bottle. I did get a rubbing alcohol ring when I set down the cap on my coffee table tho. Beware of that possibility whatever you use in these bottles.
All in all, a nice kit and I give it 4 stars.
title: I got leaking inside the cap, but it didn't come out.

review_text:
I really wanted to love this product: the name is great and memorable and the pictures in the product listing contain a cruelty-free logo.

I was surprised when I squeezed it out that (i) the product was very thick (ii) it was tan in color (not that I'm a colorist, but it seemed like an odd color for this product), and (iii) the product's odor is offensive.

I put a little on each of my forearms - as much as is in the picture. It is VERY thick and seemed a little gritty to me - more like a paste than a gel or lotion. It took more effort to work into my skin than any other type of skin product I've tried.

The odor hit me when I squeezed it out, but it got worse when it was on my arms and worked in. My hands also felt greasy, but then the itching started. Both the itching and the odor were so troubling that, within a few minutes, it was time to wash the stuff off my skin. Soap and water helped, but only time completed the job. I don't know how to describe the smell other than as (i) unpleasant and (ii) something which I will do my best to avoid again. As such, sorry, Sorry Mom, but it's one and done.
title: Sorry, Sorry Mom, but it's greasy, smells badly and my arms now itch.  Literally stinks

review_text:
I'm not a big believer in all the hocus pocus claims made by every single women's skin care product on the market. They all say they will make your wrinkles or crows feet shrink or smooth out or give your 40 something face a "youthful" glow again. At best, these products moisturize, cleanse, and some provide some protection from sun exposure damage.

This serum from EB5 makes the usual claims, of course, but it's not as outrageously expensive as so many of the other brands. It's a creamy concoction and it takes very little to cover my entire face - the instructions say just use one pump and that is sufficient. There's a faint scent that makes me think of Asian food - I guess that's the sesame seed oil,but the scent fades quickly. It takes about ten minutes to fully absorb into my skin, so I am not using this immediately before going to bed. I haven't had any skin irritation or breaking out in a week. Nor have I noticed any visible difference in the overall condition of my skin and no "plumping" in my laugh lines. My face is soft and it feels just a moisturized as when I use only my regular moisturizer. So....four star rating for no negative reaction and for being a nice enough moisturizer requiring very little product.
title: Doesn't irritate my sensitive skin. Creamy,  requires very little to use. No actual change to wrinkles.

review_text: I usually wear two layers of nail polish- one layer of coating and one layer of normal nail polish. Mountain falls nail polish remover can remove both about the same time with other brands I have been used with the help of cotton balls. The smell is ok, not too strong. It does not over dry nails which is good, some nail polish remover makes my nail dry and white.

review_text: This is a great comb. The material is strong but flexible. It has a nice feel and texture. It's not too fine or wide in the tooth spacing. The metal tail is slightly smoothed and rounded for safety when coming in contact with your delicate scalp. Some combs can be too pointy and can be painful.  I use various products to boost the illusion of thick, healthy hair. I use color, highlights, tape in wefts and glue in hair, as well as toppers and sometimes wigs. All of these helpful products are impossible without a great 'Pin Tail' comb to help you with perfect sectioning and parts.  5 stars. I will update with longevity as needed, but right now I am quite happy with this comb.
title: Must have for extensions and precision color.

review_text:
[[VIDEOID:5f071d40944ad845a102d811a0949121]] This is an absolutely amazing value in terms of quantity.
Lots of amazing colors that will delight teens and queens and the occasional club kid. Plenty of neutral pans of shadow for more conservative types, lots of great pop colors for the drama types.

You will need a good primer, like many shadows they disappear quickly without one. Some colors are also much different on the skin so don't be afraid to experiment. Sensitive eyes might want to do a swatch test.
Comes with double applicators, and a handy inside mirror.

review_text:
I have tried many many face sheet masks. While I did not notice anything special about these ones while using them, I can still think they are a great option because: 1) They are affordable ($2 per mask) and 2) Ingredients are all safe and clean (more details below).

I have used them at night, right before bed, usually leave them on for 15 minutes. Once I removed them, my skin feels fresh. The following morning, I feel my face moisturized and soft. There is enough serum to apply on the neck and chest area. There is no need to rinse after using them. Great option to use after a facial. It covers pretty well all face. I had to fold the nose area because of a recent nose ring, but it does cover the nose as well.

Regarding the ingredients, I use skincare ingredient analyzers that follow the EWG, which individually rates ingredients from 1 to 10 (lowest to highest hazard). I was impressed to see all ingredients are rated EWG1. Another interesting fact around ingredients is that there are no parabens, sulfates, silicones, alcohols, allergens and fragrances (a very common ingredient that is highly hazard).

Expiration date: 2025 (3 years after received)
title: Affordable and great ingredients

review_text: Quite frankly, I'm surprised items like this are finding their way into the US. Most cosmetic and skin care items distributed in this country have ingredient lists. I was attracted to this compact because I thought it would minimize the look of my pores and help keep my nose and forehead from becoming shiny. It is not a powder, more of like the texture of old fashioned rouge. If you press too hard with the applicator sponge, you can actually dislodge a creamy clump. I have been using this as a finishing touch. After I have all of my other makeup on, I dab a bit of this on my nose and forehead. I need to be careful because I have a lot of blue undertones to the skin under my eyes and this green can accentuate the dark circles, veins and bags under my eyes, so just a few pats on my nose and forehead are enough! It does have a cooling effect and I've noticed a bit of a smoothing to my pores. Overall, its OK. I do wish it came with instructions and an ingredients list. Having those would make me feel better about both using and recommending the product!
title: Odd little item has no instructions and no ingredients list!

review_text:
This beard shampoo offers a slight foresty scent. It isn't too overpowering and reminds you of a rugged woodsman. The shampoo lathers up easily and doesn't take more than a dime size to cover your facial hair adequately. It washes off just as easy and doesn't leave any residue or odor. It leaves your beard feeling clean as well as softer than traditional shampoos do.

The bottle holds almost 8.5 ounces, so unless you've got a Dusty Hill or Billy Gibbons ZZ Top beard, this bottle should last you for a good while.It's competitively priced and offers a good value for beard shampoo as many other brands offer much less in ounces for the same cost. So if you want a softer, cleaner beard at a fair price, then I'd suggest this one.

review_text:
[[ASIN:B01699WMHO Anti Aging Serum - The Best Hyaluronic Acid Face Cream Moisturizer for Anti Wrinkle & Skin Tightening Night Cream. Tempt by Cazbe Skin Care Products Rejuvenate your youthful glow]]

I am always looking for something that will help me turn back the hands of time. I want to look good for as long as I can and because of that I've often used Vitamin C serums. I know they are effective and help with aging skin a lot, My skin has always been a challenge. I have oily skin with large pores and sometimes have uneven and dull skin. I also have some expression lines on my forehead. I wanted to start using this serum as soon as I got it home. The serum comes in a very nice bottle which I like a lot because not only is it pretty but the serum is delivered in an airless pump which distributes exactly the right amount of serum to my fingertips for easy application to my face. Since Vitamin C products are easily oxidized I appreciate the product being dispensed this way so that it protects the serum and keeps it effective. I have been using this serum the morning on cleansed skin after toner, and then again at night before moisturizer on clean skin in the same way. The serum has a nice scent that is not overpowering and it only takes a pump or two of the serum to cover my entire face. The serum doesn't feel greasy or oily and it's just the right consistency to spread easily. There was no burning or irritation with this product, and it absorbs well into my skin with no left over residue. My skin feels smooth, silky and refreshed after I apply this serum as if my face has a refreshing blast of moisture. It looks supple and moisturized for hours and I've noticed my makeup stays on better. I have been using the serum for about two weeks now. Since then I have noticed a lot of amount of improvement in the tone and smoothness of my skin. It doesn't look as dull and my skin also looks firmer. My skin is more radiant and soft and the expression lines in my forehead appear a little softer and the improved clarity of my skin is noticeable. My skin also looks better when I'm not wearing makeup. My skin has improved a little and I've been asked what had I been doing to make my skin look better? That makes me feel more confident that the serum is working. I am going to continue to use this serum and consider it a good value worth every penny of the asking price here since a little goes a long way.
title: Anti Aging Serum - The Best Hyaluronic Acid Face Cream Moisturizer

review_text: I got this gel nail set on a whim. I wasn‚Äôt really expecting much from it or for it to work well. I was super skeptical as I was doing my sisters nails. She has much more elegant hands and long nails so hence why she was my model for trying this gel kit. The instructions are clear and explain what is used for what and how to use them in the proper steps. The instructions also come with tips which were helpful. You get a UV light, a buffer and pads, topcoat, peel off base coat, two colors, prep it and end it solution. The UV light is a plug in and not battery operated. It is a bit of a time-consuming process ‚Äì it took me about an hour to do my sisters nails. I love the gray that comes in this set, but the pink leaves a bit to be desired. The gray applies beautifully and isn‚Äôt translucent unlike the pink. The pink was still translucent even after two coats. The instructions state to cure it for 45 seconds (well this is how long the UV light stays on) but her nails were still sticky. So, I cured them several more times and they remained sticky. I finally decided to just finish them with the topcoat. I cured them then the instructions stated to take a pad with the end it solution and rub her nails to rid the tacky coating. I was super nervous about this step and was worried that all my work and her patience would‚Äôve been for nothing. After wiping her nails, I didn‚Äôt see any polish transfer or dents on her nails.  Which I had let out a sigh of relief. I suppose they‚Äôre tacky because of the sort of polish this is and didn‚Äôt need to cure it as much as I did. This was my first time doing anything like this, but I think her nails turned out nice. I‚Äôm sure with practice, I‚Äôll get even better. I really love that you can get salon nails from the comfort of your own home. I also believe this kit is well worth the money. What you pay for this kit is what you‚Äôd pay in one salon visit, at least for me. I am so pleasantly surprised by how nice this is and so glad I decided to give it a try!
title: Salon Manicure At Home

review_text:
I like Jack Black products, I use and like their lip balm for example.

I had some specific uses in mind for this product when I saw it come up in Vine. Recently I began bleaching the dye out of my hair to go natural rather than let it grow out; I've been using argan oil very happily as a moisturizing treatment. I thought the Jack Black Epic Moisture would be a great comparison item against the argan, but it hasn't been. Sure, it temporarily smooths your hair. It makes the ends stick together a little bit after you use a flat iron. But as soon as I wash my hair, it feels the same as it did before. The oil isn't imparting any lasting benefit to my hair. I have thick, curly hair for the record.

Yes, it makes my hands and elbows smooth(er) temporarily. But I have to keep applying it. As a moisturizer for my face and neck, it just seemed to do light duty. I need more than light duty, especially for the severe winter weather we are having. On the plus side this did not aggravate my rosacea and didn't cause any zits to form.

They suggest a use for a beard conditioner/softener; I'd never thought of that use but have to wonder if a man would enjoy this fragrance lingering near his nose/mouth throughout the day.

This SMELLS great. The temporary effects it gives are nice, if you are looking for that. It's not what I needed and I wouldn't buy it, but I know there are a lot of men and women who need just this light kind of oil and would find it beneficial. It's a nice quality product, as I've found most Jack Black products to be, but if you have heavy-duty moisture needs this one won't be what you want.

UPDATE: My husband decided to grow out a goatee, and he's using this oil on his facial hair twice a day. It's helped soften the hair so that it's not rough and stabby.
title: For light duty needs, a temporary fix UPDATE for beard use

review_text: [[VIDEOID:387349b9b035106729d3ca1d6b5d9718]] I ordered the UV lamp because my smaller lamp took forever to dry and was not efficient. At first I thought the product was cheaply made because of how plasticky it felt but I love how lightweight the lamp is. It is convenient to carry to any room or house of preference. You honestly do not even need a tutorial or instruction because of how simple it is to use. Simply plug in the lamp and it will automatically motion detect your hand and foot to trigger the lamp to dry. The default timer is set for 120 seconds but there are four other settings you can change to - 10s, 30s, 60s, 99s. I always have trouble with nails because it never dries fast enough and I‚Äôm impatient and end up messing up my nails before it dries. With this lamp, I went through two cycles and they dried up to perfection. Highly recommend this product for anyone seeking a UV lamp!

review_text:
I've been using extensions since 2006, due to health issues causing extreme hair thinning. I used to get the fused extensions at the salon, 1500 dollars back in the day. They broke off from the weight of the extensions because my hair was so fine and thin. The fused glob of hair was just too much and so many fell out. I started buying the clip in hair, taking the clips off and using them as weft hair. I use salon pro white glue, much like eyelash glue but used for weft hair. It is a wonderful solution and I still alternate between tape in hair and the clip in wefts. I also buy closures and custom color, to make my own toppers. What a job! But, I'm happy with the results. I have more control over the color and style, and I feel 'normal'.

This hair is a medium to coarse texture, thick, and has a really nice body wave. The is soft and smooth and doesn't feel damaged. It will blend with fine hair. You can use a straightening iron, just be sure that you can control the temperature. Once you burn this hair, it will stink and it will be ruined. However, if you control the temperature and use care, the hair looks great straight and shiny. You can also curl the hair. I have used felted hot rollers, and those work really well. They are safer, and not as damaging, and the curls last so long.

These 16" extensions are very nice. Although the ad isn't quite accurate. The color is a darker caramel blond, and a reddish brown. This is not piano keys, but close. The wefts are not in the ombre style, they are bold and varied high lights. If you look at the ad images, the photos showing the people aren't shown with this product in their hair. The wefts laying on a surface showing the color differences between the offered colors is the most accurate. I've offered some images that show the color more accurately. You can custom color most of the wefted hair, but adding color is easier. Typically the hair has so much red in it that it is impossible to cover or remove, and the dye can be hard to remove. You can add a longer root to eliminate the chunky roots. My hair is so fine, the sewn edge can be obvious, so have a good match to my natural blonde ash tone roots helps. Any coloring will add to the damage and potentially shorten the life of the hair, but for me it makes me happier to have an exact match to what I want, and I am hard to match for color.

The weight of the hair is shown in a photo in ounces. In grams, we get a little over 104 grams, far less than the advertised 120grams, and I would complain about this and have, just not for this brand. That being said, the fullness and the weight is still good, and the wefts seem to feel average when compared to what I usually order. If you order the longer options, the hair will be thinner, as most hair is sold by weight. 120 would be better, of course. This weight is significantly lower than 120grams.

Shedding. Over the last 7 years or so, shedding has become a real problem. It never used to be this bad. There is a weft glue that is meant to slow or prevent shedding and I always use it. It makes the weft more stiff, but if you use the weft the way I use them, you need to do something to protect your weft hair. You can find it online. If you are using this hair for special occasions and clipping to thick strong hair and are simply making your hair more full, wild and glamorous, then you may not need to worry about shedding. I did finger comb this hair once out of the packaging, and there was significant shedding. Again, I say, this is a common issue now, and unique to this particular brand. I have no idea what changed but the wefts should not shed this much, but they all do this with most brands. I have to say that if the wefts didn't shed so much, they would last for a couple of years or longer. Also, keep in mind I use the wefts differently, so clipping, as intended, may offer longer life and far less shedding.

The length is 16" and the hair hangs nicely, with a gentle, natural taper. There is a very nice body wave. It's not a blunt edge finish, which is nice.

The clips are the same type that I see on most clip in kits. They are small, and hold nicely even on fine hair.

Over all, I think this is a great value and will require the extra effort to keep them looking great over a year or more. To keep human hair looking good and tangle free, I use the sleep and shine shampoo and conditioner. It keeps the hair fresher and mat free longer. There are a lot of youtube videos that can help you with application and care, and give you tips and tricks.

4 stars.

review_text:
This is alcohol free and fragrance free. It is vegan and cruelty free. It is also paraben free. They said it is made with natural, safe ingredients. The ingredients are listed on the product page (I included them at the end of my review). It is made in the US.

This has vitamin C and E in it to give antioxidant protection, brighten, and nourish skin. Coconut water helps hydrate the skin. Licorice extract helps brighten skin. Rambutan peel extract seals in moisture and promotes a healthy skin barrier.

This is a nice setting spray. The sprayer on it is okay. It does spray kind of unevenly so I need to make sure I go around my face good so I get everywhere. But, the spray on it is a nice, fine mist, so I love that. It‚Äôs not like I‚Äôm getting spit in the face with uneven bursts in spots or like a jet sprayer on the face. It‚Äôs nice and soft. It has a nice faint smell. There is no artificial fragrance in it, so it must just be from the ingredients. I‚Äôm not really sure what the scent is because it‚Äôs so faint, but it isn‚Äôt bad at all and I really barely notice it.

I apply this after I‚Äôve applied my foundation and concealer to add some hydration back into my skin. After it dries down (which doesn‚Äôt take long at all) I go in with powder in specific areas where I need it. I have normal to dry skin, more on the dry side with some extremely dry areas. So, powder can make me look really dry and even cakey. So, I like to use powder right where I need it then do the rest of my powder products like blush and bronzer, and finally use a hydrating spray to melt it all into the skin. This works great for that. It melts it all together really well. It isn‚Äôt matte but isn‚Äôt dewy either. Just leaves your skin looking natural.

I don‚Äôt think this really helps my makeup last any longer. I find it wearing down the same amount as it would if I didn‚Äôt use a setting spray, so I wouldn‚Äôt use this if I were trying to get my makeup to last longer. It also doesn‚Äôt make the makeup transfer-proof. It definitely transfers still! But, it‚Äôs great at hydrating and melting the makeup together. It also

Overall, I think the spray is good, just not great. It hydrates my skin nicely, melts together my makeup well and adds in hydration that I lost after applying makeup. But, it doesn‚Äôt help keep my makeup from transferring or help it last longer. I have other sprays that cost far less and do just as good of a job, even better, at hydrating my skin and melting my makeup together, and they even help keep my makeup from transferring and last longer. So, I give this 3 stars. I‚Äôll use it up but won‚Äôt purchase it when I run out. If you‚Äôre just looking for something to hydrate the skin and melt your makeup together, this could work for you. Personally, I‚Äôd recommend cheaper options that do the same. But, if for whatever reason this is the one you want, it works well for that. But, if you want it to help make your makeup transfer-proof or to last longer, this didn‚Äôt do that.

FULL INGREDIENT LIST
Water (Aqua), Sorbitan Oleate Decylglucoside Crosspolymer, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Fruit Powder, Glycyrrhiza Glabra (Licorice) Root Extract, Nephelium Lappaceum Peel Extract, Phenoxyethanol, Glycerin, Propanediol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Sodium Chloride, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Allantoin, Sodium Ascorbyl Phosphate, Tocopherol, Caprylyl Glycol, Potassium Sorbate, Hexylene Glycol
title: Hydrates & melts makeup together but doesn‚Äôt help makeup last

review_text:
I have used various countertop water flossers in the past such as the countertop WaterPik and the [[ASIN:B07HRNGS3Q Truwell Handheld Water Flosser]]. I love the idea of a hand held irrigator and this does work to remove most stuck debris from between the teeth. What is nice about this one over the other handheld I tried, is that there is very little splash back. However, I personally do not like that the reservoir is not removable for drying.

IN THE PACKAGE
- One reservoir attached to handheld flosser unit
- One USB cable (wall adapter NOT included)
- One instruction manual
- One standard jet nozzle
- One orthodontic nozzle (larger brush)
- One pocket nozzle (smaller brush)
- One tong scraping nozzle (what looks like a spoon)

I charged the unit fully before use. The white light on the side blinks when charging and remains steady when it is fully charged. Note the charging port is hidden behind a silicone nub below the grip dots on the top of the unit. Be careful to cover the charging port with this nub when the flosser is in use.

There is an on/off switch and a mode switch. The three water pressure modes are soft, standard, and massage can be cycled through using the mode switch prior to turning the unit on. The jet tip (or any of the other three tips) gets inserted into the top. Be careful to make sure it is seated with the notch in the groove as the first time I put it in the hole, I did not have it seated all the way. To eject, press the release button to the left side.

The reservoir IS NOT removable. Instead water enters through the small opening on bottom through which one has to fill the unit. I do not like that the reservoir is attached as I have to drain the remaining water out of that hole and leave the door open for drying. Also, the little button through which the water enters can easily break after lots of use. I personally would prefer not to have to use that hole.

I held my mouth almost totally closed during use and tried all three modes. I did not have splash back, which was very nice. Splash back is usually typical of almost any type of water flosser so to some extent I was surprised. This flosser does work to dislodge most debris between teeth but not everything because it is not super powerful but is powerful enough. I am also impressed that the manual is relatively well written; kudos to the manufacturer on this. Normally, I feel as if I am reading Pig Latin when I receive products from China or other countries.

In summary, my biggest disappointment with this unit is the attached reservoir that prevents me from drying this out easily.
title: Relatively strong water flosser but reservoir is attached which makes drying it nearly impossible

review_text: I don't know why I even tried with this wig. The part is nice but....yeah....too white to look like a my hair part color. If I move it away from my head the bangs look weird. It was extra silky feeling and just felt wiggy. Looked like it was made decently except for the part color. Didn't frizz or shed much but just not for me.
title: Cute but not worth it

review_text: Smells so good and makes my hair so soft! Arrived safely sealed up in plastic. Perfect size for travel. Did not notice any buildup on my scalp. The instructions say to go from mid length of hair to the ends, but I also did my roots and scalp and it was fine. I have thick long hair, so this literally gives me one use, maybe two, if I follow instructions, and only do from mid hair to ends. A tad pricey but you get a great product.
title: $12 for one hair treatment ü§ë

review_text: Very useful for facial cleansing and they're disposable so they're good to use when traveling.
title: Thick and Absorbent

review_text: Decent enough but wish they were sharper, especially at the ends. I use the ends of the snipper to do hang nails and trim the corners of the fingernail itself. Granted I use them for more than cuticles, which wears them out faster, but when I think of the name Soligen I expect a product of superior quality.

review_text:
I love the pump that this shampoo comes with. It's great to easily add the product to your hand while showering. This is also a nice big size for the price.

The shampoo is a bit watery, but it does lather very nicely and my hair feels smooth and silky after using it. I feel like I can use this everyday without drying out my hair. The shampoo smells really nice and I love the scent - it's not too strong. I had to use maybe two pumps to fully cover my hair while showering.
title: Love the pump

review_text: I love anything that has a unicorn or mermaid color scheme to it. These make up brushes are so pretty and are actually amazingly soft and work extremely well. Sometimes you forgo quality for looks but that‚Äôs not the case with these brushes. They are super well-made and I haven‚Äôt had any problem with bristles falling out. I highly recommend this set.
title: Perfect for any mermaid or unicorn lover

review_text: Not sure which I like better:  this one or the lavender.  They both smell nice, goes on smooth and a little goes a long way! Hands down, the best silver based lotion out there.
title: Great lotion and smells nice!

review_text: Helps relieve achy muscles and relax my body after a stressful day
title: Relaxing time

review_text:
These are reasonably durable mask holder bands. The "fingers" that hold the mask straps are thin, but I didn't experience any tearing even when tugging on them a lot harder than they would be exposed to in normal use. The fingers are widely spaced and can deal with flat-style elastic bands without a problem.

My only quibble is that they are a bit too short in length. While using them does increase mask comfort around my ears, they would be better if they were about an inch or so longer.

Not ideal, but a helpful aid to increase long-term mask wearing comfort especially with masks that have short ear loops.

review_text:
The built-in brush makes this product easy to apply. If you need to put your makeup on in a hurry, this stuff is really great.
You can control how much comes out onto the brush and then use the brush to apply it evenly. It works as well as most primers in that it hides some of the medium, if not the large, pores.
Easy to tuck in your makeup bag.
title: Couldn't be easier

review_text:
I love this set!! Microfiber is the best especially for wavy/curly hair. It helps minimize frizz and it is very absorbent.

I found very useful the turban for whenever I am doing my makeup or I am just at home and don't want to touch my hair to avoid getting tangled or frizzy. I haven't really used it after a shower.

The twist head towel is great for plopping your head for some time after shower. My routine using this has been: right after shower, apply leave-in, curl cream, and plop for 20 min using this twist head towel. After that, I remove the towel, apply gel and diffuse for 15-20 min. Also, I wear it "backwards". I know the button should be at the bottom of the head, but I found using it at the top also works for me.
title: Perfect to reduce frizz!

review_text:
These makeup sponges are a great value for the price. I love that so many come in the set and the assorted colors are a nice touch.

The design of the sponges is simple. There is a flat slanted bottom I like to use for patting in foundation and the pointed tip that is great for concealing or reaching small places around the nose, eyes, etc.

The sponges are reasonably sized, but when placed under water they expand greatly! I do think these are great for the money, but for foundation I‚Äôm not crazy about the finish it gives. The sponge is somewhat firm, so I feel like it can be hard to really sink the product into the skin, but it is great for concealer or using the sponges dry for powder. Overall, I‚Äôm satisfied!
title: Great value!

review_text:
The SIAMHOO Face Wash Refreshing Facial Cleanser with Natural Sea Buckthorn is a rich , thick cream that lathers well. A little pea sized amount is sufficient to clean your face and neck. My skin felt clean and moisturized, and did not have feel like there was a cleanser residue left on my face.

Did it deep cleanse my pores? I can't really say. I also cannot tell if it removes makeup or not, as I have not worn any since March of 2020. But it did make my skin feel clean and soft.
title: A little goes a very long way

review_text: When I first used this brow pencil I wasn't a big fan, but it definitely grew on me. I'm not sure if it needed the top layer to wear out, but after a few uses the product started applying really well and was able to fill in my brows without looking strange. It's very pigmented, but at the same time it doesn't make your brows look too dark...I would definitely say it makes my brows look more natural than when I used my brow pomade.
title: great brow pencil!

review_text:
Certainly well priced and effective though not impressive.
It‚Äôs a wet mud mask which I did not find as moisturizing as dry mud masks, nor did my face feel particularly cleaner or tighter.
It didn‚Äôt however feel dried or stripped. It‚Äôs comparable to most drugstore masks so it‚Äôs really fine just not a wow product.
title: Average

review_text: Works well. Full coverage and easy to use closure- hook and eye on stretchy elastic. I don't know about it being "ultra soft", it feels like most hair cutting capes...kind of plastic like. Works for my family's needs.
title: Does the job

review_text: I got this for my husband for christmas and boy am I glad I did. He doesn't wear cologne ever and thankfully he loved these scents and so did I! I am so happy i got these!
title: Every one smells amazing!! Great set!

review_text: I love these silicone "cotton swabs"!! I personally have a problem with the feeling of cotton balls and cotton swabs but they are useful. I didn't even realize something like this existed so I was super excited to try it out. I used it for touching up makeup and they are really easy to use and clean. It comes with different textured heads too so it's very versatile.
title: Love these

review_text: Unfortunately I didn't notice much different with this spray. I think it smells nice and it a great idea to calm kiddos but I fine essential oil rollers on the bottom of the feet to have more contact with the skin making them more effective.
title: Didn't notice any difference

review_text:
This Kneipp lavender lotion is thick, but it‚Äôs not a heavy or greasy lotion. This probably provides moderate hydration for normal skin, but for me it feels quite lightweight. I think it‚Äôs a nice cream, but I prefer a richer lotion or cream that comforts my dry skin more and provides longer lasting hydration. When I‚Äôve applied this after an evening shower, my skin feels reasonably moisturized for a few hours but it‚Äôs not enough moisture to last all night so I need to reapply before bed. This seems best for those who don‚Äôt need heavy hydration and enjoy a lavender scent.

This lotion does have a moderately strong lavender scent that even lingers on my hands after washing. It smells nice and doesn‚Äôt bother me, but it may bother those sensitive to fragrance as this is just in the range of what I can tolerate as strong lavender has been a headache trigger for me. This lotion has retinyl palmitate, which is especially risky mixed with sun exposure. This lotion seems best for evening use given that lavender can be relaxing and retinyl palmitate doesn‚Äôt mix well with sun. Like it. 4 stars.
title: Feels Lightweight For My Dry Skin, Better For Evening As Strong Lavender Scent & Retinyl Palmitate

review_text: Jeweled headbands are all the rave. The headband is made of a satin like fiber and the are glued on. Headband is quality. Very feminine Sunday Brunch look.
title: Jeweled Headband

review_text: Overall, this is a pretty decent kit if you want to forgo a trip to the salon. It has all of the products you need to complete your lash perm, however there is a bit of a learning curve to it. Once you get the hang of it however, it goes pretty smoothly. I myself have used several different kits, and this one ranks in my top 5. The results were pretty good and there was noticeable lifting of my lashes. I estimate I will be able to get roughly 3 perms out of this kit in total which is pretty good, especially considering the price. It says it can last upwards of 4 weeks, but I guess only time will tell how long the perm actually lasts. Regardless, you cant beat the price for an at home DIY.
title: Nice Kit

review_text: Don‚Äôt buy these. They break all the time. They‚Äôre stuck together in the package, they‚Äôre just cheap.
title: Cheap bands that break

review_text:
This entry level toiletry bag from Gonex is a no frills waterproof organizer that has a hook for hanging and various compartments for keeping your stuff organized. Overall this is a pretty decent bag that can hold about a medium amount of items. It's easy to clean, open and hang which is nice.

There are few drawbacks. First, the fabric that forms the pockets needs to be firmer and tighter. It won't hold top heavy items while it's hanging which annoying. Second, the hook needs to be bigger. It definitely will not fit on a closet pole or seven some towel racks.

This is worth getting if you need a low cost toiletry/makeup bag and you don't have top heavy items to store.
title: Good value for an entry level toiletry bag

review_text: Presentation is nice and product is good. It‚Äôs very light on the eyes but definitely adds definition and makes a difference. I like how light the brush is and nicely it applies to the lashes. It does not bleed either!
title: Lash heaven!

review_text: I use this to wash my hair. I find when I wash my hair myself I don't feel as though I got a good scalp rub. Using this allows me to get everywhere and feel as though I've done so. My hair is thin and there are no issue with the hair getting trapped or snagging. I use the pink on my friend hair and she has commented that her hair washed is less rough. And on inspection the scalp is as clean as if I did it with my fingers. I also use this when I'm adding oils to my hair scalp. I use it to massage it in and again I feel as though the job has been effective after using it. I use it daily for just a general massage of my scalp. I find it very useful.

review_text:
I use this sunscreen when I go out walking during my 1.5 hour exercise routine and it is sweat resistant and oil free. The product works well and has protected my face from a rosacea outbreak.

Thank you for taking the time to read my review and photos of this product. I hope it has been helpful in providing you with more information.

review_text:
Things to note about this lip gloss:

- They are small. They fit nicely in my small fanny pack with my phone and wallet.
- They have a nice delicious scent.
- They are flavorless.
- They're not sticky, I feel that makes them last a little less on lips but that makes them way more comfortable to wear.

For reference: they are not like your typical VS gloss, they are way less thick.
I love them and recommend them to use on top of a lip tint or lipstick.

review_text: As someone with really thick and long hair, my wife was super skeptical when she saw this product. That being said, because she actually does love and trusts the brand she decided to give it a go. She found their hair ties about 2 years ago and hasn‚Äôt looked back since. As a new mom who never previously had her hair up she was always looking for something that would properly hold ALL of her hair up and back out of her way. She really liked these because not only did they do that, but as long as she didn‚Äôt tie her hair too tight they generally didn‚Äôt leave lines in her hair after use either. She usually uses the thick type hair back and finds that unlike other brands these don‚Äôt get knotted up in her hair even being silicone/plastic material. However, even with her trust in the brand, she wasn‚Äôt totally sure this would work. Her first go with this wasn‚Äôt successful, but she tried again and was able to get it in. She was shocked how well one/two tests held up all her hair so well. She tried it in our daughter's hair and had the same hard time holding the hair all together while trying to wrap and twist the device. It is a really cool device overall, however, it just isn‚Äôt super easy to use and it also isn‚Äôt portable being that you can't easily throw it on your wrist like you would a normal hair tie.

review_text:
I am fully dedicated to how amazing this moisturizer is. I've been using it both morning and night with the serum from the same brand and the results speak for themselves.
Of course I'll always have one or two hormonal breakouts, but this has decreased my other acne, evened my skin tone, and really calmed down my overall redness.
I'm in my early 30s and just now getting more serious about anti aging skincare because I'm trying to avoid fillers for as long as I can.
This moisturizer is extremely rich and I only need to use a tiny fingertip size for my neck and face. It works great under makeup and doesn't feel greasy or heavy.
As far as the price tag goes, it's a lot...I personally don't think I could afford to purchase on a regular basis and really wish that it was more affordable because I feel like a lot of people would benefit from this cream.

review_text: Moisturizing and flavorful at the same time! I swear we go through chapstick like no tomorrow here. The tubes are the usual size and with a large pack, come in handy for keeping around the house and cars. These would also be great for stocking stuffers for the holidays! The flavors are strongly scented, but mild enough to not pick away if the taste were stronger. Overall, these are a great pick for an affordable yet well protected chapstick.

review_text: The hair brush is a nice set the paddle brush is smaller size as you can tell by the picture to the wet brush.  However is a good brush and i haven't had a problem with it..  The large comb is very nice for brushing out wet hair.  The detailing comb is good for sectioning out hair however do to the small handle it is hard to hold.  The water sprayer is very nice and has a good mist.  However the worst brush is the red one doesn't go into my hair at all and haven't had the greatest time trying to get that brush to work, that is my worst brush out of the set for me.

review_text:
I've not come across a face soap in this format -- it's a stick format, much like an antiperspirant. You rub the stick on your dry face, then use water. It's different but very easy to get used to quickly.

The soap doesn't lather all that much but it does do a good job of cleaning without drying out my face. The scent is quite nice, with the eucalyptus coming through the most. It's a medium/mild level of scent that is noticeable without being overwhelming. The scent does not linger after rinsing. The soap itself is black due to the inclusion of charcoal.

The dispensing tube is well done, with a screw base that pushes up the soap easily and evenly. It also has a screw top cover, which is a nice touch for keeping the lid affixed if you take this while traveling or use it in a gym bag.

It's an unusual but enjoyable twist on face soap. A bit pricey for the amount you get, but it's sufficiently unique to justify the cost, in my opinion. Five stars.
title: Unusual soap, but works well

review_text: I have seriously replaced all my old hair ties with these. They are the best! They have just enough stretch to make it easy to do a bun but are not too stretchy that they stretch out. They easily retain their original size. I absolutely love the variety of colors, most hair ties come in just brown and black but these are so versatile! They also come in an excellent bag that keeps them all organized instead of just randomly in a drawer, and the box is nice enough that it could be a pre-wrapped gift. Excellent presentation. I highly highly recommend these and will never buy the "normal" kind of hair tie again.

review_text: I got this for my boyfriend to use around his nose where he gets blackheads. He can quickly use this and be done. I have noticed an improvement in this area since he started using it.

review_text:
I often use the Olay water activated cleansing cloths. The problem is you can only use them at home. They are not individually wrapped. You have to take one and put it in a ziplock.

review_text: I use this all the time for my monomer liquid. I like that they have lids so after I'm done I can still keep the liquid in them. review_text: This is one of the smoothest, nicest tongue scrappers I have used. The metal is so smooth, it does the job well, and clean up is a snap. Compared to my old copper one, this one is a million times better. Very nice!

review_text: Very complete and pretty decorations

review_text: I really like this stuff! I didn't get this for Covid, I got this because I have always been a very frequent hand washer.  I hate oils or anything sticky on my hands.  So being able to have something like this in my purse is key.  I also wanted it to have when out camping or doing outdoorsy stuff where you don't always have access to a sink and water.  Until this, I usually carried wet wipes/baby wipes, but this is a more environmentally friendly option that I'm onboard with.  I really like the smell, the feel, and the way it absorbs and doesn't leave your skin feeling sticky.  Does the job and I've ordered more.

review_text:
This is a lightweight cream that is probably more suitable for warm weather. I absolutely love the smell of this cream, it is very fragranced. It has a nice floral scent that reminds me of being in a field of flowers. Sensitive skin may not enjoy that much. But, it does feel very luxurious and silky on the skin.

My cons are that I did not get any dewy effect from the cream and it actually gave my skin a mattified appearance. I think it just may not be hydrating enough if you have skin on the dry side like mine.

While I won‚Äôt be using this as my every day moisturizer, I did find that it worked well for me as a makeup base before I apply my foundation.

The other thing I noticed is that there is a slight hint of shimmer to the cream when looking at it in the jar. It is not chunky and can‚Äôt be felt on the skin. It almost looks like the cream has more of a pearlized finish.

Overall, I would recommend this cream to those with oily or combination skin. It just didn‚Äôt work the best for my dry skin.
title: Not moisturizing enough for my dry skin

review_text:
I have been buying these little soap dispensers with soap sheets in them for a while now (cos of the pandemic) and this pack is probably the best value I‚Äôve ever had. I‚Äôve paid $5 for one filled dispenser, with a generic scent one time, and i still thought that was a great thing to have. With this pack of 8 different scents, for less than $16, you‚Äôre getting a package for less than $2.
To say they are handy is an understatement. They are a Godsend. I don‚Äôt know how often I‚Äôve gone into a bathroom, and the soap dispenser is empty. I was recently camping, and their soap dispenser in the toilets was empty during our whole stay. One thoughtful camper, left a bar of soap in a clear plastic cup, but it was a bit grimy with hairs on it, and i didn‚Äôt want to use that. With these handy pocket, or purse sized dispensers, you have a fresh sheet of soap each time. And they lather up very easily, as soon as they get wet.
They are small enough to put into the smallest purse, even your wallet, or pocket, and you‚Äôll never be caught it out the ability to wash your hands.
These will last a while, as I‚Äôm not planning on giving any away. I might offer a sheet here and there, but not a whole dispenser for goodness sake. I‚Äôll tell them where they can get their own.
I‚Äôm currently using the Tea Tree and it‚Äôs very fresh. I do feel very clean after using these, and will continue to recommend them to my friends.
Great value pack.
title: I‚Äôd give these 10 ‚≠êÔ∏è if i could

review_text:
These are pretty adorable holiday ears! I have a larger head then some lol and a ton of curly hair. This band fits on my head and the ends rest just to the top of my ears (like where eye glasses would rest). It does not dig into my temples. THis is to big for a 2 year old but a 7 year old has no trouble.

You can see a bit of the glue/ building materials when you inspect these closely and the minni ears are not as full as a pair you would get at a Disney park but these are well done.

review_text:
I can not use these on myself and I struggle using these on my girls.

Sometimes the clips are really picky. They don't clip, or it feels like too much hair, so you lessen the hair, and then it is not enough hair to hold the clip.

I really love the concept, but by the time I put in, to try to get it to work, the simplicity that this product should bring is removed, and I just should have done what works first.

review_text: This is a vey well made spray nozzle.  This is able to to be as a quick release or you can remove the attachment and thread it on to a regular hose without any issues.  It comes with 2 extra rubber washers to help prevent leaking while in use.  All you do is twist the tip go the nozzle to change it from a spar to a jet stream.  The jet is fairly powerful and does a good job at cleaning porches ,driveways house siding, etc.  Just be careful on paint, especially old paint while on the jet stream as it can and will likely chip away pieces of paint.  This is very well made, very durable, and works as you would expect.  I have only used it a few times now but I give it a spritz of wd-40 when I am done to help prevent it form rusting,  This could be overkill but it is showing no signs of rust.  This does a good job of cleaning off siding and in the spray function it does well at watering flowers too.  This is an overall good spray nozzle and should last quite some time.
title: Easy to connect to regular threaded hoses or a quick connect. Jet is powerful and spray is gently.

review_text:
I really love this hydrating and moisturizing product.

I wasn't sure I would at first. Although the box is in English, and has clear instructions and ingredients, the product itself lacks those things. Celimax comes in a streamlined bottle that looks like mineral water. Aside from the general disaster that could pose with small children, the FDA requires cosmetic products sold in the USA list their ingredients on the bottle in English.

The ingredients, by the way, which I wish Amazon would leave a spot for cosmetic vendors to include in their listings, so we would know before we order in case of allergies, are Sedum Sarmentosum, Butylene Glycol, Water, 1,2-Hexanediol, Glycerin, Glycereth-26, Polyglutamic Acid, Hydrolyzed Hyaluronic Acid, Ceramide NP, Xylityglucoside, Anhydroxylitol, Xylitol, Dipotassium Glycrrhizate, Citrus Tangerina Peel Oil, Pelargonium Graveolens Flower Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia Oil, Glucose, Phospholifpids, Diethoxyethyl Succinate, Caprylic/Capric Triclyceride, Ammonium Acryloylidimethyltaurate/VP Copolymer, Hydrogenated Lecithin, C12-13 Pareth-9, Disodium EDTA, Chlorphenesin.

Having said that, I poured a little bit of the product onto a cotton pad in the evening and dabbed it onto my face, and onto the back of my hands. It initially felt just a bit tacky, but almost immediately absorbed. I followed up on my face with my nightly cream. My face this morning feels AMAZING. The moisture level is through the roof.

I also want to mention fragrance. Like 95% of chronic migraine headache sufferers, I have a sensitive sense of smell. Anything cosmetic that has perfume (think lip smackers) or added scent has the potential to make me nauseous and bring on a migraine. This had just a faint authentic citrus smell, vaguely pleasant, which thankfully disappeared within a few seconds of hitting the cotton ball. That kind of fragrance is ideal.

And the effects are just amazing. I don't see my face all day, but I can sure see my hands on the keyboard. My hands are visibly more plumper, less dry, and more hydrated. I am loving this product. Hopefully they're in process with getting their bottle properly labelled and safe for distribution in the United States, because this is my new routine. Such results!
title: Love this Hydration!

review_text: Muy chulas extensiones de cinta. El pelo es 100% natural, super suave y lindo.  Excelente calidad.. Las recomiendo.
title: Bellas extensiones

review_text:
I used this exfoliator while washing my face, and it worked good for that. Seems to exfoliate well. I plan to continue using it.

It would have been nice if there was some way to hang it.
title: Decent exfoliator

review_text: I've heard of face cream made from snails (or their secretions) and was a bit hesitant to give it a try. This is from Korea so perhaps that's not so surprising, and has a nice citrus scent to it, is a nice thick cream (no SPF) that does a really good job moisturizing my skin. It absorbs quickly and gives it a nice, dewy look and does seem to provide some tightness to it.

review_text: I have curly/wavy hair that I like to use microfiber towels on because it reduces frizziness. These towels are EXCELLENT, I really really like them. Both designs are really great for "plopping" if any curly-haired girls are familiar with the term. And my hair comes out so great when I let it initially dry in one of these. I finish it off with a blow dryer with a diffuser but this gets out all the excess moisture and being able to put it up really keeps it out of my way. It came with a couple of scrunchies as well. And the gray and white stripes are really cute. I'd definitely recommend this towel pack!

review_text:
Used on it's own or as an ingredient in a DIY skin preparation, rosehip seed oil is a multi-use mini-miracle.

It can be used on the skin or hair, it even works wonders on dry, ragged cuticles.
Rough cracked heels and/or scaly feet? I took equal parts of this oil and emu oil, and rubbed it on my feet after dry buffing. Socks go on, and like me, you will wake up to soft, silky feet.

Any oil can go rancid, so keep it in the fridge.

Very pleased with the quality of this rosehip seed oil I was given to test.

review_text: works just like soap! perfect for on the go, you can throw in your bag or purse
title: perfect for on the go

review_text:
These nail polish remover pads come individually wrapped & there are 10 in the box.

They smell just like normal, traditional nail polish remover & we all know what that smells like. Strong!!! As soon as I tore open the packet ... bam. That smell hit me.

The actual pads come out of the packet folded in half, have a pinkish color & they seem to be made out of felt or a felt like fabric.

I decided to use one to take off my bright Red toenail polish. The first 2 nails came clean but then I started to notice that the remover pad was smearing the polish all over my toes & leaving finger nail polish color on my fingers.

Overall, the pads do work but you're probably going to have to use at least 2 at a time. That means only 5 nail polish removals per box & for the price listed, I find them highly overpriced.

Excuse my swollen foot picture, I'm trying to show how using just 1 nail polish remover pad left my toenail/toe area with a pinkish red hue.
title: Just Okay üíÖ

review_text: Pumps out thick and hand soap like... Works to a nice lather. Scent is wonderful potpourri apple spice! Cinnamon, nutmeg, sandalwood forward with a soft fruit background. Goes on gel like, washes off fairly easy. End result is a bit on the dry side but the trade off is very soft and clean feeling skin/hair.

review_text: These brushes are of excellent quality and comparable to Moroccan oil argon oil infused brushes. I own 2 of the 43 MM brushes and jumped on the 53 MM brush when I saw it was available. I love the Lange brushes I have but prefer larger barrels to give my long thin hair extra volume at the roots.  These brushes are great quality and deliver an excellent blow out. My hairs smooth and soft with minimal frizz and it stays that way throughout the day. Argan oil infused brushes have been a game changer with my wavy frizzy hair. While the price is high for some I can promise that it‚Äôs worth every cent and you won‚Äôt be disappointed.
title: Comparable to Moroccan Oil brushes

review_text:
First of all this is very well made with quality materials that so far are holding up very well to daily use. I have a lot of long hair that I usually put up in a big clip under a shower cap when I shower. Many shower caps can't handle the volume of hair and the big clip but this cap is a great size and covers all of my head/hair without a problem. I also love the extra detail of the lining on the front edge of the cap, maybe silicone(ish). It is a bit tacky and sticks comfortably to my skin so the cap doesn't slip back exposing the front of my hair line.

This cap is on the expensive side but I am still very happy with it and definitely recommend it!
title: I love this shower cap!

review_text: In the colder weather my lips get really pale but most lipsticks I try don't look natural enough for daily wear. This one is different. It's matte so it looks more natural and the color is gorgeous. It lasted about 4 hours before needing to reapply so that would be my only complaint but overall it's great.
title: Beautiful natural color

review_text:
Pictures do not do these headbands justice. There was another reviewer who said how nice they looked - like Swarovski crystals - more high end. Her description was great and her photos were good - but the photos are nothing like the actual headbands. They look soooooo much better in person. They really do look like lovely high end bands. I was surprised how nice they look on - in real life. In the box - you are like - they are OK. But once on - WOW!

Now they do not grip the head or hair really - sort of loose on top of my head but they are secure on the sides. I didn't feel like they were coming out or anything. They are relatively comfortable to wear as well. BUT they will not really hold your hair well - either. These are really just for looks mostly - which is fine with me as they REALLY are pretty. Are they perfect - no - on two of them the beads are spaced a bit here and there - in your hair you won't even notice, though. Plus they come in a variety of colors. I can wear up to three and make it look cute.

I guess you could wear these with jeans and a tee for some pizazz and more of a girlie look - but they really are pretty enough for special occasion events and parties, and stuff. Especially in low light situations - the crystals catch the light and look really lovely!

If you find this review helpful - why not click the "Helpful" button? Thanks! : ) If you found my review helpful, why not click the "Helpful" button. Thanks! : )
title: Wow! Soooooo pretty!

review_text:
There's been some distress recently over supposed fakes or the ingredients being changed, but it appears they aren't fake and haven't changed.

I checked in the Wayback Machine, and the ingredients for the one I checked (Coconut & Vanilla) were the same at the Native website on January 2, 2019 as they are now.

The confusion is that there are two different versions, one regular and one called "sensitive," for several of the same scents (including Coconut & Vanilla), and they have very different basic ingredient lists. I've verified this at the Native website.

Here's the basic ingredient list for the regular versions. (Some fragrance ingredients are also added for all but the unscented.)

Caprylic/capric triglyceride, tapioca starch, ozokerite, sodium bicarbonate, magnesium hydroxide, Cocos nucifera (coconut) oil, cyclodextrin, Butyrospermium parkii (shea) butter, dextrose (glucose), Lactobacillus acidophilus.

Here's the list for the sensitive versions:

Caprylic/capric triglyceride, arrowroot powder, stearyl alcohol, baking soda, shea butter, coconut oil, hydrogenated castor oil, polyglycerol-3 beeswax, jojoba esters, L. acidophilus, maltodextrin, glyceryl caprylate, glyceryl undecylenate, tocopherol (vitamin E).

I got the regular version of Peony & Jasmine Tea, Sweet Almond & Honey, and Linen & Cotton Flower. Those are sold as women's scents at the Native website, and they are quite sweet and flowery. The peony one is less strong than the other two scent-wise.

They work fine, as these things go, pretty good for deodorizing, not designed to be anti-wet.

They go on fairly dry, not very sticky (make sure you're dry first).

Doesn't take a lot. No problem with stains.
title: No fakes: Two different basic ingredient lists, one regular, one "sensitive"

review_text:
9 different colors you can choose from, 3 of them are glitter/sequins. A free gift is included which is basically gold glitter.

The dual forms are way to big for my hands, good thing I had another set of dual forms already.
It also comes with the "gold stickers" nail extensions in case you want to mold your nails from the top. But you got to have some practice to follow this approach. Otherwise, it will take you forever to distribute and mold your nails.

All poly gels come sealed. They do match the color listed on the outside of the little bottle. Even though they are small, they can last a few rounds since you don't need a lot of product for each nail.

Once the poly gel is cured, you will need to apply a top coat since they are sticky after cured.
title: Great variety of poly gels

review_text: This face palette is so pretty‚Äîthe blush is the perfect shade for my light/fair skin and blends out beautifully. The blush is not super pigmented, but I prefer my blushes to be blendable so they look more natural. The gold highlighter is gorgeous, it is not glittery but more of a shimmer. It is buildable, so you can make it look natural or blinding. The contour/bronzer is probably my least favorite part of the palette but I still like it. It was a little difficult to blend, it blends out best with a big, fluffy brush. The shade is somewhere between a contour and bronzer, it‚Äôs a little too warm for my skin to be used as a contour so I blend it out more like a bronzer. I have really been enjoying this palette lately and have been reaching for it often ever since I received it!

review_text:
I got this Emilia bath oil for my 1 year old daughter. She has mild eczema, so her skin is pretty dry and sensitive compared to other babies. I always choose her skincare product carefully. I also prefer natural ingredients products and avoid chemicals that might lead to irritation. This Emilia bath oil works great! It‚Äôs mild and smells so nice. I add few drops in my hand palms and rub her damp skin during bad time. It moistures her skin and leaves her skin soft and smooth. The other reason I love this bath oil is that it saves my time applying lotion on her. I sometimes skip her lotion routine if I used bath oil in bath time because her skin isn‚Äôt dry at all.

The only complaint I have on the product is this oil arrived leaking all over the package.

review_text:
This comes in an outer product box. It‚Äôs made in the UK. It is talc free, cruelty free, and vegan.

This has a very simple ingredient list - Corn starch modified, distarch phosphate, silica. I liked that.

It comes in simple packaging - It says it is sustainable packaging. It is an amber colored glass bottom (at least it seems like glass). It is thick, so seems durable. The top seems like tin. Mine was dented when I got it. Not sure how but it just came that way. The top twists off. Inside there is a plastic piece with 4 holes in it. There‚Äôs a sticker covering the holes that you remove. I like that it only has 4 holes. Loose powders can be so messy and I store mine in a drawer, but sometimes they get knocked over in the drawer and the powder goes into the cap and when I remove the cap I have to be careful not to get it everywhere. Because of that, I‚Äôll usually only uncover like 3 of the holes on a loose powder. It means less powder getting out into the cap if it tips over. But, with this only having 4 holes I didn‚Äôt feel the need to do that.

The powder is finely milled. It feels silky and smooth. It is white. It goes on mostly transparent. I‚Äôm really pale and was surprised that this made me look a little paler when I first applied it. I ended up going over where I applied the powder with a clean brush to get any excess off and that removed the pale look. So, the next time I used it, I used a damp sponge. I picked some up on the sponge, dabbed it off on the back of my hand to spread out the powder and get off excess, and then pressed it into my skin. That worked much better. It left my makeup set and smooth, without looking pale at all. It doesn‚Äôt feel or look dry or cakey. It gives a nice smooth, matte finish to the skin, but not too matte. I have normal to dry skin, more on the dry side with some extremely dry areas. So, I only powder where I have to. This doesn‚Äôt make my dry areas look or feel any drier and doesn‚Äôt accentuate them either.

Overall, I really like this powder. It keeps my makeup looking nice all day. I don‚Äôt have breakthrough sweat or oils coming through it. I work 12 hour shifts and I‚Äôm on my feet running around for a lot of that time, so I often sweat. A lot of powders I‚Äôll end up sweating through and needing to touch up throughout the day. I didn‚Äôt feel the need to do that with this. I really like it a lot. When I first saw how pale it made me after applying it the first time, I thought I was going to end up hating this. But, I‚Äôm glad I dusted off the excess and tried a different way of applying it the next time. Both ways work, but the damp sponge definitely is the best way I found for me. If you‚Äôre looking for a really nice powder, I‚Äôd recommend this!
title: Can make you look pale. Only takes a little & will not look pale at all

review_text: I ordered C'est Moi Gentle Cleansing Water for when I need to quickly remove my make-up. The product is similar to Micellar Cleansing Water and works well as a cleanser. With a few drops on my cotton pad, I was able to remove my make-up with no residue. Be careful when you dab the water onto the cotton pad as it can pour out. Though the product is described as a no-rinse cleanser, I would recommed washing your face after using the cleansing water. I worked out after removing my make-up with the cleanser but the product got in my eyes and it irritated them like when soap gets in your eyes. It's a good product for make-up removal but not enough to change my cleansing routine.
title: Cleanser for Make-up Removal

review_text: There are well packed and so far I‚Äôve had no problem with them.
title: Well packed.

review_text:
At various times in my life I have rotated between using a razor vs a cordless shaver. While I prefer the closeness of a razor a cordless shaver does save time and money. The Arcitec 1090 is Norelco's high-end cordless shaver that has oodles of features.

Likes-

- Time display showing remaining battery life.
- Ease of cleaning the heads after use
- Suction cups on the base to hold the unit firm to counter-top
- Nick-free shaving
- The charging pod makes an ideal traveling case

Needed Improvements and/or dislikes-
- Not the closest shave - after shaving my face feels similar to what it is like 12 hours after using a razor
- Not sure why there is such a large cost difference between the Arctitec 1090 and the 1050. The 1090 has a time display and the charging pod, but I have hard time seeing that as to justifying the cost difference.
- Not sure if this product is actually an upgrade from the older "Lift-and-Cut" technology they previously advertised. My impression is that the new shave is about a wash with the old one.

Final Summary- While I enjoy the ease and comfort of the Norelco Arcitec 1090 I am not sure if the added features make it worth the additional cost over the 1050 - and thus costing it one star. However, as a whole I have no problems giving the product a hearty endorsement!
title: Nice Shave...but beter than a razor?

review_text: I did not realize how much dead skin I had. Once using this product, it little comes off like little toilet paper rolls (I know gross). I usually use them on my husbands back. These are great to use before shaving to avoid getting ingrown hairs. I also use these once a week before applying self tanner. I use these after I have been in the shower for a few minutes and my skin has softened. Great product!
title: Seriously cannot live without these

review_text: I am by no means a professional. I just recently started derma rolling. I prefer to use the micro needle roller first. It isn‚Äôt the most comfortable feeling, but you get use to it. I do it while I am watching T.V. To distract myself. While rolling, I put the jade roller in the refrigerator. Once I finish with the micro needle, I apply hyaluronic acid, and then roll with the jade roller. It is SO SOOTHING. The roller has two sides- a large end for the planes of your face, and a small end to get in smaller areas like under your eyes. I only use the micro needle roller once a week-usually on Saturday nights. It does make your face a little red, but it goes away by morning. I use the jade roller a couple times a week, especially after stressful days. Just so you know, make sure to sterilize both rollers or you will have major breakouts from spreading bacteria around. I keep alcohol in a small spritzer to use on both before each use. The  packaging was sufficient, and I would feel comfortable giving it as a gift.
title: Great starter set!
